Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の子
Entry.EnglishText: Boy

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の子
Entry.EnglishText: Girl

Entry.JapaneseText: おばあさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: <unk19:D0FF1FC822E00C80>
Entry.EnglishText: <unk19:D0FF1FC822E00C80>

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 外で何か音がしてるよ。 ああ、見に行きたいなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: There's some sort of sound coming from outside. Aww, I really wanna go check it out!

Entry.JapaneseText: 外で遊べなくなったから、 ここのグミ試食係になったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've started tasting the gels here after they said I wasn't allowed to go outside and play anymore.

Entry.JapaneseText: アルバイトなんて、 大人みたいでカッコイイでしょ？ バイト代は、一日グミ一個だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Working part-time is really cool, ain't it? My part-time job pays a gel a day!

Entry.JapaneseText: 何の音か知らないけどさ、 外に出られないから 確かめようも、逃げようもないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not sure what that sound is, nor can I go outside and check. And even if I did, I can't really leave...

Entry.JapaneseText: ここのお孫さんに言われて、 オレも手伝う事にしたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The little boy here told me that he was going to help me out.

Entry.JapaneseText: グミ作りの仕事ってのは 奥が深いねえ。
Entry.EnglishText: Working on making gels is surprisingly profound.

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんだよガジュマが……！ 今度は家の中からも 追い出そうっていうのかよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What are you looking at, Gajuma? Are you trying to kick me outta my house, too!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマだけ外出禁止なんて、 不公平だよな！
Entry.EnglishText: Keeping us Huma inside is unfair!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマはトイレ禁止にでも すりゃいいんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: At the very least, ban Gajuma from going to the bathroom!

Entry.JapaneseText: 身長が四メートルくらいの、 角と牙が身体中に生えてる人が 暴れてるって本当？
Entry.EnglishText: Is it true that there's a 4-meter tall person with horns and fangs rampaging through the city?

Entry.JapaneseText: だとしたら、スゴイね……
Entry.EnglishText: If so, that would be incredible...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私、忙しくて、 誰か来てもわからないの。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm too busy to have seen anyone come in.

Entry.JapaneseText: 悪いけど、二階にいる おばあちゃんに聞いてくれる？
Entry.EnglishText: Maybe you should go ask my grandma upstairs?

Entry.JapaneseText: うちのおばあちゃん、 たまにはどこかに 連れてってあげたいな……
Entry.EnglishText: I wish I could take my grandma somewhere once in a while...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今度、おばあちゃんを 女王様のお披露目の儀式に 連れてってあげるの！
Entry.EnglishText: I want to take her to see the Queen's inauguration ceremony!

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカか…… 楽しみ……♪
Entry.EnglishText: Going to Balka sounds like fun!♪

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、おばあちゃんの 様子がヘンなの……
Entry.EnglishText: My grandma has started acting strange lately...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの事、キライだって 怒ってばかり…… それに、疲れてて……心配。
Entry.EnglishText: Always talking about how she hates Gajuma... Always getting angry and tired... I'm worried...

Entry.JapaneseText: えっ、何か音がしてる？ お仕事してたから 聞こえなかったわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Hm? Was there a sound somewhere? I probably didn't hear because I was so busy.

Entry.JapaneseText: 言われてみると 何か聞こえるけど…… そのうち止まるわよね？
Entry.EnglishText: I can hear it, now that you mention it... It'll stop...right?

Entry.JapaneseText: 街の人、ケンカばっかりして、 仕事してないのかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone's always fighting... Don't they have jobs or something?

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は大忙し！ ケンカする前に、やる事が あると思うんだけどなぁ？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm really, really busy! I believe people should finish their work before picking a fight with others.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私、みんなを仲直りさせる グミを考えてるの！
Entry.EnglishText: You know, I've been thinking of creating a gel that would make everyone get along!

Entry.JapaneseText: 名前はね…… 『ニコニコグミ』！ きっと完成させるわよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm gonna call it the "Smiling Gel"! I'm sure it'll be a hit.

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチって、こう見えても、 グミを造ってるのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: This may not look like much, but I'm making gels at the moment.

Entry.JapaneseText: グレープグミは、 私が考えた新作なの。 お店で買ってね！
Entry.EnglishText: I just managed to invent these Grape gels. Make sure to buy them at the shop!

Entry.JapaneseText: 誰かが街中で暴れてるらしいですが、 この家は街の外れですからの……
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that someone was rampaging in the middle of the city, but since this house is at its very edge...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何にしろ、見つからねばよいのですが…… ああ、くわばら、くわばら……
Entry.EnglishText: I pray that it won't get caught up in that... How scary...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は耳が遠いので、 誰かが家に入ってきても ようわかりません。
Entry.EnglishText: Unfortunately, I wouldn't know if anyone has come in because my hearing isn't that good.

Entry.JapaneseText: 人をお探しなら、下にいる 孫娘に聞いてください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please ask my granddaughter downstairs if you're looking for someone.

Entry.JapaneseText: この年寄りには もう楽しみな事など そうないですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: For an old lady like me, there's not really a lot of things I can look forward to.

Entry.JapaneseText: 若い人みたいに、何にも 興味は持てないし……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't really bring myself to get interested in anything, unlike the youth...

Entry.JapaneseText: 女王様のお披露目の話を聞いて、 久しぶりに胸がドキドキしましたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: When I heard that the Queen is going to be inaugurated, I felt excitement for the first time in ages.

Entry.JapaneseText: ゴルドバの日には孫娘を連れて、 都に行こうかと思います。
Entry.EnglishText: I think I'll take my granddaughter to the capital once the <Blue>Day of Goldba<White> comes along.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマは あっちへお行き！
Entry.EnglishText: Go somewhere else, Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>幻の島<White>ねえ…… そういう事は海に住む人に聞かないと。 例えば、そうねえ……海賊とか？
Entry.EnglishText: The <Blue>Island of Illusions<White>... People well-versed with the sea would know more about such things... Let's say...pirates, perhaps?

Entry.JapaneseText: でもいまどき、海賊なんて いないわよねえ…… どうかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: But pirates don't really sail the seas these days... I wonder why?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの顔って、なんだか 威圧感があるのよね！ 近寄らないでほしいわ！
Entry.EnglishText: You Gajuma look very intimidating! Please don't come any closer!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマと顔を合わせるのは イヤですけど、この年になって 引越しも大変ですし……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't really like seeing Gajuma, but moving to a new place is difficult when you're my age...

Entry.JapaneseText: もう、つくづく つらい日々です……
Entry.EnglishText: Everyday has been painfully hard for this old lady...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの顔って、なんだか 威圧感があるのよね！ 近寄らないでほしいわ！
Entry.EnglishText: You Gajuma look very intimidating! Please don't come any closer!

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は耳が遠いもんですから、 外で音がしてると言われましても わからないんですよね……
Entry.EnglishText: Since my hearing is poor, I find it hard to hear any sounds from outside...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマが外出禁止なら、 ガジュマは屋内立ち入り禁止に すべきよ！
Entry.EnglishText: If us Huma have to stay indoors, then I say that Gajuma should just stay outside, then!

Entry.JapaneseText: 野宿なさい、野宿！
Entry.EnglishText: Back into the wilderness where they belong!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマが外出禁止なら、 ガジュマは屋内立ち入り禁止に すべきだと思いませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: Don't you think that Gajuma should just stay outside if we Huma are confined inside?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとちがってガジュマは 体だけは強いんですものね。
Entry.EnglishText: Unlike us Huma, their physical strength is the only thing they have going for them.

Entry.JapaneseText: 種族の事を考えるのはやめました。 孫娘が言うんです……おばあちゃん、 怒ってばかりだと疲れるよ、って。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll stop thinking about race. You know, my granddaughter told me the other day, "Granny, being mad all the time is just making you tired."

Entry.JapaneseText: 前はいつもニコニコしてたから、 疲れてなかったって…… 長生きしてほしいからって……
Entry.EnglishText: She told me that when I used to smile all the time, I was never tired, and that she wants me to live longer.

Entry.JapaneseText: そう、以前はもっと楽しくて…… 種族の事なんて考えた事すら なかったって、思い出したんです。
Entry.EnglishText: And she's right, it was better when I wasn't fretting over racial differences.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私みたいな年寄りでも できる事が見つかったわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Even I found something I can do in my old age...

Entry.JapaneseText: 「みんなを仲直りさせる事」 だから今、色々準備してるの！
Entry.EnglishText: I want everyone to get along together, that's why I'm preparing something right now!

Entry.JapaneseText: この暑さは、年寄りには こたえますねぇ……
Entry.EnglishText: This heat sure is hard for an old lady like me...

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチの孫はできた子でねぇ。 よく働いてくれますよ。 遊びたい年頃だろうに……
Entry.EnglishText: My granddaughter over there is a kind girl. Look at her working so hard. You'd think she'd rather be playing at her age...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ここには いないみたいね……
Entry.EnglishText: Doesn't look like she's here...

Entry.JapaneseText: あの娘はいないか……
Entry.EnglishText: She's not here...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『棚』 棚自体はなんの変哲もないが、 食料品や雑貨などが分別なく置かれている。 住人の人柄が出ている棚。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cabinet - The cabinet itself is nothing to write home about, but food and other goods are placed haphazardly on them. It reflects the residents' personalities.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『棚』 引き出し、引き戸などがついている。 なんの変哲もない棚。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cabinet - It has drawers, sliding doors, and many more. A nondescript cabinet.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『棚』 棚自体はなんの変哲もないが、 食料品や雑貨などが分別なく置かれている。 住人の人柄が出ている棚。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cabinet - The cabinet itself is nothing to write home about, but food and other goods are placed haphazardly on them. It reflects the residents' personalities.
